title: Using dedicated for special use wood for cooking
vignette: A caretaker takes central assembly place wood to bake his bread at home.

options.text: He must repay with an added fifth for misuse.
No penalty because it was for sustenance.

title: Accidental benefit from funds with special status
vignette: Coins designated for the central assembly place fall into a purse used for shopping.

options.text: Replace the amount plus a fifth once noticed.
Only repay the principal value.

title: Misused offering then returned
vignette: An animal designated for offering was ridden briefly before being brought to the offering place.

options.text: The ride constitutes misuse of dedicated property requiring compensation.
Since it was unharmed, no additional payment.

title: Clothing made from fabric for special use
vignette: Tailors fashioned garments from leftover central assembly place cloth by mistake.

options.text: They must reimburse the central assembly place with a surcharge.
Return the clothing without extra cost.

title: Using made special status animal for labor
vignette: A farmer plows with his set-aside portion ox forgetting it was special status.

options.text: He owes misuse of dedicated property payment.
No penalty if accidental and brief.

title: Public inadvertently enjoys property with special status
vignette: central assembly place wine is distributed mistakenly at a town feast.

options.text: Community collectively repays the value plus a fifth.
Waive repayment since it benefited many.

title: Dedication revoked unknowingly
vignette: A donor cancels his dedication privately yet administrators are unaware and use the item.

options.text: No misuse of dedicated property since it was no longer special status.
Administrators must repay because they believed it special status.

title: Funds with special status coin used to pay wages
vignette: A financial manager mistakenly pays workers with central assembly place funds.

options.text: Workers return the coins and receive regular payment.
Let them keep the coins; treat it as central assembly place expense.

title: Lost track of made special status materials
vignette: Wood donated for the offering place gets mixed with ordinary logs.

options.text: Treat the entire pile as special status.
Estimate and set aside an equivalent portion.

title: Benefit after Exchange payment
vignette: Someone exchanges a special status vessel by paying its value, then uses it at home.

options.text: Permitted once properly exchanged.
Still disrespectful to use special status items.

title: Shared responsibility for misuse
vignette: Several partners profit from selling an animal with special status.

options.text: Each pays according to his share.
Only the one initiating sale pays.

title: Ignorance of an item's special status
vignette: A buyer purchases central assembly place goods unaware of their status.

options.text: Once informed he must repay with a fifth.
He is exempt since he lacked intent.

title: Benefit after partial payment
vignette: A woman begins repayment for misuse but enjoys the item before completing payment.

options.text: Further use is still prohibited until fully paid.
Partial payment allows continued use.

title: Misuse by Central Assembly Place administrators
vignette: staff members take home small amounts of aromatic resin with special status as a perk.

options.text: They must reimburse and face discipline.
Perks are acceptable compensation.

title: Unintentional misuse of dedicated property discovered late
vignette: Years after using a bowl with special status, someone learns it was never removed from special status.

options.text: Pay misuse of dedicated property even years later.
Too late—statute of limitations should apply.
